channel.title: Tor browser crashing and whonix glitching
channel.description:
Hoping someone could help.
I have installed Virtualbox as per the instructions here: `https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox/Recommended_Version`
* I am running the latest kicksecure as my host on bare metal Also Running Latest Debian kernel and linux-headers as instructed.
* vtx and vtd are both enabled as well in bios settings. workstation and gateway both have 2gb of ram Also have given both 128mb of vram
* I am Having alot of issues in terms of whonix glitching and displaying random colors here and there and also core dumps.
The main issue is: * Tor Browser is consistently crashing as well giving the error:
``` ERROR: Tor Browser ended with non-zero (error) exit code!
Tor Browser was started with:
/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser --verbose --allow-remote .
Tor Browser exited with code: 139
``` I tried to update tor browser but still having the same issue with it. I had this issue running on regular non kicksecure debian 11 host as well.
Downgrading the host kernel fixed the issue on my other machine But i don't want to downgrade my kernel on this kicksecure machine. Other vitrual machines are not suffering the same issue despite the kernel version.
Thanks.

item.title: Tor browser crashing and whonix glitching
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
x99x:

Tor Browser is consistently crashing as well giving the error:

Crashing right after startup or can you use Tor Browser for a while and it randomly crashes after a while?

x99x:

I had this issue running on regular non kicksecure debian 11 host as well.

This means the issue can be reproduced without Kicksecure involved?
Plus on top of this this means the issue can be reproduced without Whonix being involved?

In that case, the issue is unspecific to Kicksecure / Whonix:

Whonix – 26 Jan 22

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

Could you please attempt to fix the issue as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle and report back here?

x99x:

Other vitrual machines are not suffering the same issue despite the kernel version.

Which operating systems and versions inside VirtualBox did you try?

Could you try VirtualBox Generic Bug Reproduction please?

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

Read full topic
item.source: Tor browser crashing and whonix glitching

item.title: Tor browser crashing and whonix glitching
item.dc:creator: x99x
item.description:
Hoping someone could help.

I have installed Virtualbox as per the instructions here:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox/Recommended_Version

  • I am running the latest kicksecure as my host on bare metal
    Also Running Latest Debian kernel and linux-headers as instructed.

  • vtx and vtd are both enabled as well in bios settings.
    workstation and gateway both have 2gb of ram
    Also have given both 128mb of vram

  • I am Having alot of issues in terms of whonix glitching and displaying random colors here and there and also core dumps.

The main issue is:

  • Tor Browser is consistently crashing as well giving the error:
ERROR: Tor Browser ended with non-zero (error) exit code!

Tor Browser was started with:

/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser --verbose --allow-remote . 

Tor Browser exited with code: 139

I tried to update tor browser but still having the same issue with it.
I had this issue running on regular non kicksecure debian 11 host as well.

Downgrading the host kernel fixed the issue on my other machine
But i don’t want to downgrade my kernel on this kicksecure machine.
Other vitrual machines are not suffering the same issue despite the kernel version.

Thanks.

Read full topic
